intro: Dyctisperma lasiocarpus, commonly known as the rough-fruited dyctisperma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruits are woody capsules that remain on the plant for an extended period, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dyctisperma lasiocarpus is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
